title: The Dog Who Cried Peach
theme: A remarkable dog discovers a portent: the sky is raining peaches. While villagers scramble and the oracle cow declares vast changes, only the dog remembers what came before.
narrative_arc: Portent appears → Peaches fall → Pooch sees first → Remarkable observation → Silence held → Sort of thing unprecedented → Crying begins → Utensils grabbed → Stinking dog avoided → Other dogs flee → Villagers detest → Pressure mounts → Cow steps forward → Special oracle speaks → Declaration made → Vast change proclaimed → Before remembered → Washing prepares
narrative_story: It began with a portent — cracks in the sky, whispers in the wind. Then came the peaches — falling like sweet, fuzzy rain. The pooch saw it first. He was remarkable — sharper than other dogs. He sat in silence for a long time, watching the fruit fall. This was a sort of thing that had never happened before. Then he began to cry — not from sadness, but from the weight of knowing. The villagers grabbed every utensil they could find to catch the peaches. But the dog was stinking — he'd rolled in something foul that morning. The other dogs avoided him. Even the peaches seemed to fall elsewhere. The villagers grew to detest him. His smell. His crying. His knowing. Pressure mounted. Someone had to explain this miracle. The cow stepped forward. She was special — the village oracle. She began to declare: 'This is a sign! A vast change is coming!' Everyone listened. Everyone except the dog. He remembered what came before — the last time peaches fell. So he went to wash himself in the river, preparing for what was next. The cow could declare. The dog would prepare.

characters.mnemonic_image: Cracks spreading through ice - the first sign of coming change
characters.story: It begins with a PORTENT — cracks in the sky, whispers in the wind. 'ZHAO!' the heavens COMMAND attention. The sign spreads like cracks through ice, each fracture pointing toward inevitable change.
characters.tone_emotion: COMMAND - sharp announcement of coming change

characters.mnemonic_image: A tree bearing the fruit of omens - sweet fuzzy messengers
characters.story: Then come the PEACHES — falling like sweet, fuzzy rain. I GASP 'TAO?!' — are these really falling from nowhere? The tree bears the portent's fruit, each peach a soft messenger from the cracked sky.
characters.tone_emotion: GASP - rising disbelief at miraculous fruit
characters.narrative_position: The miracle — peaches rain from the sky

characters.mnemonic_image: A large dog with a prominent dot - the original canine form
characters.story: The POOCH sees it first. I GROAN 'Chwannn...' — the weight of being first to witness. This large dog carries the dot of distinction, burdened with knowledge others don't yet have.
characters.tone_emotion: GROAN - guttural burden of early witness
characters.narrative_position: The witness — first to see the omen

characters.mnemonic_image: A figure standing out from the crowd - exceptional presence
characters.story: He is REMARKABLE — sharper than other dogs. I GASP 'YO?!' — is he really that different? Something about him stands apart, a quality the others lack. Exceptional awareness marks him as unique.
characters.tone_emotion: GASP - rising recognition of exceptional quality
characters.narrative_position: The distinction — sharper than other dogs

characters.mnemonic_image: A black dog sitting perfectly still - quiet contemplation
characters.story: He sits in SILENCE for a long time, watching the fruit fall. 'MO!' I COMMAND myself to stillness. The black dog knows when to be quiet. In darkness and silence, truth becomes visible.
characters.narrative_position: The vigil — watching in knowing silence

characters.mnemonic_image: Flesh over fire with a dog watching - the natural order transformed
characters.story: This is a SORT OF THING that had never happened before. I GASP 'RAN?!' — has the natural order changed? Dog and fire and flesh — the elements of the ordinary — now witness the extraordinary.
characters.tone_emotion: GASP - rising confusion at unprecedented event
characters.narrative_position: The unprecedented — nothing like this before

characters.mnemonic_image: Two mouths weeping over a dog - grief amplified
characters.story: Then he begins TO CRY — not from sadness, but from the weight of knowing. I SING 'KOOO...' — sustained like a mournful dove. Two mouths cannot contain this grief. The dog beneath them weeps for what he knows is coming.
characters.tone_emotion: SING - sustained wail of prophetic grief
characters.narrative_position: The lament — crying from knowing too much

characters.mnemonic_image: Four mouths around a dog - vessels for catching and containing
characters.story: The villagers grab every UTENSIL they can find to catch the peaches. 'QI!' I COMMAND the vessels into action. Four mouths surround the dog — bowls, pots, basins — all pressed into service for the miraculous harvest.
characters.narrative_position: The scramble — vessels for the miracle

characters.mnemonic_image: A nose detecting a dog - the source of foul smell
characters.story: But the dog is STINKING — he'd rolled in something foul that morning. 'CHOU!' I COMMAND my nose to close. The nose above the dog detects what cannot be ignored. Even miracles cannot mask this stench.

characters.mnemonic_image: A dog with a hook or phrase - the common canine
characters.story: The other DOGS avoid him. I GROAN 'Gooo...' — even my own kind reject me. The dog with the hook of common speech, the ordinary canine, turns away from the remarkable one who smells too foul.
characters.tone_emotion: GROAN - guttural weight of social rejection
characters.narrative_position: The rejection — even dogs turn away

characters.mnemonic_image: A cliff pressing down on satiation - overwhelming disgust
characters.story: The villagers grow TO DETEST him. His smell. His crying. His knowing. 'YAN!' they COMMAND him gone. The cliff of their disgust presses down — they are satiated with his presence, overflowing with revulsion.
characters.narrative_position: The hatred — the village turns against him

characters.mnemonic_image: A cliff bearing down with weight - crushing force from above
characters.story: PRESSURE mounts. Someone has to explain this miracle. I SING 'YAAA...' — sustained under crushing weight. The cliff of expectation bears down on everyone. Something must give. Someone must speak.
characters.tone_emotion: SING - sustained compression from all sides
characters.narrative_position: The tension — demand for explanation builds

characters.mnemonic_image: Horns and body of the sacred bovine - the oracle beast
characters.story: The COW steps forward. I GASP 'NYO?!' — is she really going to speak? Her horns catch the light as she moves through the crowd. The sacred bovine carries wisdom the dogs cannot possess.
characters.tone_emotion: GASP - rising surprise at oracle's appearance
characters.narrative_position: The oracle appears — the special cow emerges

characters.mnemonic_image: A cow at a temple - sacred beast of distinction
characters.story: She is SPECIAL — the village oracle. 'TE!' her presence COMMANDS respect. The cow at the temple, sacred among cattle. Only she can speak for the heavens. Only she carries that distinction.
characters.tone_emotion: COMMAND - sharp assertion of sacred status
characters.narrative_position: The status — the oracle's sacred role

characters.mnemonic_image: A cow's head above a mouth - the oracle speaks
characters.story: She begins TO DECLARE: 'This is a sign!' 'GAO!' the oracle COMMANDS attention. The cow above the mouth — sacred authority giving voice to cosmic truth. Everyone must hear what the heavens announce.
characters.tone_emotion: COMMAND - sharp proclamation of divine message

characters.mnemonic_image: Water declaring endlessly - ocean of change approaching
characters.story: 'A VAST change is coming!' 'HAO!' the declaration COMMANDS comprehension. Water carries the proclamation to every shore — the change is vast as the ocean, endless as rivers. Nothing will remain the same.
characters.tone_emotion: COMMAND - sharp announcement of enormous scope
characters.narrative_position: The scale — the change is immense

characters.mnemonic_image: A person walking ahead - the one who goes first
characters.story: He remembers what came BEFORE — the last time peaches fell. I SING 'SHYANNN...' — sustained memory of earlier times. The person who walks ahead has already seen this path. The dog knows because he was there before.
characters.tone_emotion: SING - sustained recall of past experience
characters.narrative_position: The memory — recalling what happened before

characters.mnemonic_image: Water meeting what came before - cleansing in preparation
characters.story: So he goes TO WASH himself in the river, preparing for what comes next. I GROAN 'Sheee...' — the heavy work of cleansing. Water meets what was before, washing away the stink, preparing the body for what the dog alone knows is coming.
characters.narrative_position: The preparation — cleansing for what comes
